remarks: Approximate division for positive rationals.  Proposition 12.7 of [BauerTaylor], p. 55 (a special case where ` A ` and ` B ` are positive, as well as ` C ` ).  Our proof is simpler than the one in BauerTaylor because we have reciprocals.  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 8-Dec-2019.)
statement:
appdivnq $p |- ( ( A <Q B /\ C e. Q. ) -> E. m e. Q. ( A <Q ( m .Q C ) /\ ( m .Q C ) <Q B ) ) $.
$d A m $.
$d B m $.
$d C m $.
